name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason:
2-Methylphenyl group: The presence of a 2-methylphenyl group can increase the melting point due to the additional rigidity and molecular weight. This effect is estimated at around +10°C.
N-phenylbenzamide group: The phenyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. This effect is estimated at around +20°C.
Carbonyl group: The carbonyl group can form strong hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, contributing around +20°C.
Ether linkage: The presence of an ether linkage can increase the melting point due to the additional molecular weight and possible weak dipole interactions, estimated at around +2°C.
